metadata.synopsis: In these dialogues, Zevlor reflects on what's happened (an attack of goblins at the gate, which the player helped with) and his mistrust of and bitterness towards the druids who are reluctantly hosting his people. He is exasperated, furious, but also eager to meet anyone who could help. In the same dialogue, we can also uncover that he is in fact a traitor, concerned only with getting these people through the goblins so he can trade them for his own safety later. In truth he is resentful and contemptuous of them, viewing them as weak.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Goto 209, 429 to trigger Plea At The Gates4. Skip through dialogue5. Killcombat to finish the combat6. Resolve conflict between Zevolor and Aradin7. Goto 51, 698. Speak to Zevlor

4.speaker: Zevlor
4.text: A scout just reported - the goblins' leadership has been decimated. We might escape this place yet.

155.speaker: Zevlor
155.text: And I hear you are the one to thank. I'm grateful.

178.speaker: Zevlor
178.text: I took a collection - from all of us. It isn't much, but you've earned it.

289.speaker: Zevlor
289.text: It's not enough, but it's all we have.

162.speaker: Zevlor
162.text: Very good of you. Thank you.

345.speaker: Zevlor
345.text: Halsin will likely want to thank you, too, mind. He returned just a while ago.

164.speaker: Zevlor
164.text: I believe he's catching up with Kagha. As for us...

149.speaker: Zevlor
149.text: It's quite a day for reunions. Halsin has returned, too - and I expect he'll want to speak with you. As for us...

37.speaker: Zevlor
37.text: No armies at our heels... Amazing. We can finally leave.

319.speaker: Zevlor
319.text: But perhaps we need not speak of farewells. We'll join your camp tonight to celebrate, if you'll have us.

29.speaker: Zevlor
29.text: Ah. You. Thank you. You stopped us from making a bad situation much worse.
29.context: InternalNodeContext: Edit 1/31/2020: This greeting used to be played at the gate, before Zevlor reached the cave. NodeContext: Player intervened and stopped Zevlor and Aradin fighting. Zevlor is grateful and a little abashed.

131.speaker: Zevlor
131.text: The stories I was raised on don't equate drow with diplomacy - I'm glad to see they were baseless.

44.speaker: Zevlor
44.text: The Blade of Frontiers. An honour, no matter the circumstance.
44.context: NodeContext: Inclining his head to us slightly - we're a well-known monster hunter

74.speaker: Zevlor
74.text: Your help at the gate was appreciated.
74.context: NodeContext: Mildly marvelling at this fact, but remaining polite - you're of a race typically known for its hostility

120.speaker: Zevlor
120.text: Never thought I'd say this to a drow, but... thank you. I'm Zevlor. And you're...?
120.context: NodeContext: Mildly marvelling at this fact, but remaining polite - you're of a race typically known for its hostility

239.speaker: Player
239.context: NodeContext: Firm, polite - and vaguely apologetic as he starts to deliver the bad news that this isn't the safe haven you thought

249.speaker: Zevlor
249.text: Well met. Though I should warn you - visitors are no longer welcome in this grove.
249.context: NodeContext: Firm, polite - and vaguely apologetic as he starts to deliver the bad news that this isn't the safe haven you thought

412.speaker: Zevlor
412.text: Right. I'd offer you supplies and sustenance by way of thanks, but I'm afraid there's little to spare.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: New here. What is this place?
30.context: NodeContext: Slightly wry, but still serious - this isn't the safe haven you think

127.speaker: Zevlor
127.text: A druids' grove, dedicated to the Oak Father, Silvanus. You'll find its keepers just as thorny, I fear.
127.context: NodeContext: Slightly wry, but still serious - this isn't the safe haven you think

312.speaker: Zevlor
312.text: Whatever your business here, I'd see to it quickly - the druids are forcing everyone out.
312.context: NodeContext: Serious - knows he's delivering bad news

250.speaker: Zevlor
250.text: This latest attack will only strengthen their resolve.
250.context: NodeContext: Wary, tired - knows the druids will be furious about the goblin attack and blame his people

442.speaker: Player
442.text: I have no quarrel with druids.
442.context: NodeContext: Explaning a serious situation - the mention of 'outsiders' is bitter - his people always get blamed for everything

302.speaker: Player
302.text: Why are they forcing you out?
302.context: NodeContext: Explaning a serious situation - the mention of 'outsiders' is bitter - his people always get blamed for everything

391.speaker: Zevlor
391.text: There have been several attacks by different monsters. The druids blame us 'outsiders' for drawing them here. Nobody's welcome anymore.
391.context: NodeContext: Explaning a serious situation - the mention of 'outsiders' is bitter - his people always get blamed for everything

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I won't be staying long - I just need to find a healer.
65.context: NodeContext: Weary, doesn't know what to do

277.speaker: Zevlor
277.text: They've started a ritual to cut the grove off from the world outside.
277.context: NodeContext: Weary, doesn't know what to do

188.speaker: Zevlor
188.text: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
188.context: NodeContext: Weary, doesn't know what to do

157.speaker: Player
157.text: This ritual - is there no way to convince the druids to stop it?

72.speaker: Zevlor
72.text: I've tried. Kagha - their new First Druid - won't see me.

208.speaker: Zevlor
208.text: You, though... I know it's not your business, but she owes you for saving this place.
208.context: NodeContext: Slowly and thoughtfully - considering you, idea just occurring to him

435.speaker: Zevlor
435.text: Perhaps you could persuade her. For more time to prepare, if nothing else.
435.context: NodeContext: Being realistic about his chances of concession, not asking too much

365.speaker: Player
365.text: I'll see what I can do.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: We'd owe you a great debt. If we're forced to leave now, more of my people will die.

121.speaker: Zevlor
121.text: We'd owe you a great debt. If we're forced to leave now, more of my people will die.

437.speaker: Zevlor
437.text: You'll find the druids at the heart of the grove. Please - make them see sense, before more lives are lost.
437.context: NodeContext: Addressing an awkward topic before he forgets - most would run from your race on sight, but he's reassuring us that we're welcome

152.speaker: Zevlor
152.text: Oh, and if it's of any concern... you're brave to walk around without hiding your heritage. I'll make sure everyone knows that you helped us at the gate.
152.context: NodeContext: Addressing an awkward topic before he forgets - most would run from your race on sight, but he's reassuring us that we're welcome

156.speaker: Zevlor
156.text: You'll find the druids at the heart of the grove. Please - make them see sense.

335.speaker: Player
335.text: Kagha's a piece of work. Let's see if your wit surpasses your might.

310.speaker: Wyll
310.text: Kagha's a piece of work. Let's see if your wit surpasses your might.

260.speaker: Player
260.text: I think you should, yes. No harm in trying the diplomatic route.

138.speaker: Gale
138.text: I think you should, yes. No harm in trying the diplomatic route.

243.speaker: Player
243.text: Let's not forget why we're here. No point in wasting precious time on a lost cause.

408.speaker: Shadowheart
408.text: Let's not forget why we're here. No point in wasting precious time on a lost cause.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: Bah. We've no time to offer aid to every whimpering pup.

380.speaker: Lae'zel
380.text: Bah. We've no time to offer aid to every whimpering pup.

375.speaker: Player
375.text: I'm sorry. I've got my own problems.
375.context: NodeContext: Disappointed, trying to be understanding

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Turning your back on those in need? Maybe we'll get along after all.
78.context: NodeContext: Disappointed, trying to be understanding

70.speaker: Astarion
70.text: Turning your back on those in need? Maybe we'll get along after all.
70.context: NodeContext: Disappointed, trying to be understanding

396.speaker: Player
396.text: I understand. I can only thank you for the help you've already given.
396.context: NodeContext: Disappointed, trying to be understanding

203.speaker: Zevlor
203.text: I understand. I can only thank you for the help you've already given.
203.context: NodeContext: Disappointed, trying to be understanding

432.speaker: Zevlor
432.text: Just keep your fists to yourself, yes?
432.context: NodeContext: Wry but hint of warning - we started our relationship with this man by punching him in the face. He's cautiously welcoming us.

228.speaker: Zevlor
228.text: We're raised to fear the drow, but you've earned your place here. I'll make sure everyone here knows that.
228.context: NodeContext: Considering us anew - most would run from our race on sight, but he's reassuring us that we're welcome

196.speaker: Zevlor
196.text: If you'll excuse me - I'd best get my people moving.
196.context: NodeContext: Ending conversation, wearily turning back to his business

303.speaker: Player
303.text: These poor souls seek a champion - and you turn your back?
303.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's addressing the player rather than ZevlorNodeContext: A bit callous bit also pragmatic. We've got our own problems.

173.speaker: Wyll
173.text: These poor souls seek a champion - and you turn your back?
173.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's addressing the player rather than ZevlorNodeContext: A bit callous bit also pragmatic. We've got our own problems.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: We've our problems, granted, but there might be some merit in shutting down a local conflict, no?
236.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's addressing the player rather than ZevlorNodeContext: A bit callous bit also pragmatic. We've got our own problems.

445.speaker: Gale
445.text: We've our problems, granted, but there might be some merit in shutting down a local conflict, no?
445.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's addressing the player rather than ZevlorNodeContext: A bit callous bit also pragmatic. We've got our own problems.

424.speaker: Player
424.text: You chose well. We have enough burdens as it is without taking on more.
424.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's addressing the player rather than ZevlorNodeContext: A bit callous bit also pragmatic. We've got our own problems.

118.speaker: Shadowheart
118.text: You chose well. We have enough burdens as it is without taking on more.
118.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's addressing the player rather than ZevlorNodeContext: A bit callous bit also pragmatic. We've got our own problems.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: We can't abandon all these people. Right?

219.speaker: Karlach
219.text: We can't abandon all these people. Right?

91.speaker: Player
91.text: A rational choice. We mustn't stray from our path.

370.speaker: Lae'zel
370.text: A rational choice. We mustn't stray from our path.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: I have my own temporal concerns. I need a healer.
248.context: NodeContext: Accepting your request for payment for helping him

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I'll find her. And I'll speak to Kagha while I'm there.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Enough about the ritual. I have my own problems.

382.speaker: Player
382.text: What are you offering for my aid?
382.context: NodeContext: Accepting your request for payment for helping him

392.speaker: Zevlor
392.text: What little we have, we'll scrape together. It isn't coin we need - it's time.
392.context: NodeContext: Accepting your request for payment for helping him

128.speaker: Player
128.context: NodeContext: Mildly concerned, grows bitter at mention of Aradin/adventurers

284.speaker: Zevlor
284.text: You're wounded? The druid Halsin's a renowned healer, but he went with those adventurers. It seems they left him behind.
284.context: NodeContext: Mildly concerned, grows bitter at mention of Aradin/adventurers

261.speaker: Zevlor
261.text: You're wounded? The druid Halsin's a renowned healer, but he didn't make it back from Aradin's expedition.
261.context: NodeContext: Mildly concerned, grows bitter at mention of Aradin's expedition

52.speaker: Zevlor
52.text: If it's not too serious, you could try his apprentice, Nettie. She's with the other druids, in the inner grove.
52.context: NodeContext: Thinking, trying to help - but not holding out much hope for your chances

254.speaker: Zevlor
254.text: They've withdrawn there to prepare this damn ritual of theirs.
254.context: NodeContext: Growing bitter at mention of the druid ritual - it's foolishness to him

300.speaker: Player
300.context: NodeContext: Recounting how his home city turned against his people

98.speaker: Zevlor
98.text: We're refugees from Elturel - we took shelter here after goblins and gnolls attacked us on the road.
98.context: NodeContext: Recounting how his home city turned against his people

169.speaker: Zevlor
169.text: We were bound for Baldur's Gate, and it was too late to turn back. Elturel had no place for tieflings after the Descent.
169.context: NodeContext: Recounting how his home city turned against his people

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *You remember it. Elturel and all its citizens were dragged into Avernus - then back out again.*

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I was there, you know. I'd hoped you'd had a happy ending.

285.speaker: Zevlor
285.text: We got out alive. That's what matters. And you did too, by the looks of things.

211.speaker: Zevlor
211.text: We'll live to tell another tale, if we can just convince these druids not to turn us out on our backsides.

287.speaker: Player
287.text: Let me guess: Your old neighbours called you 'devilkin' and acted like they never knew you.

379.speaker: Zevlor
379.text: How easily such a nasty word slips through the mouth of someone you thought you knew.

269.speaker: Zevlor
269.text: We thought we'd found sanctuary here, but the druids have determined to turn us out.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Gods, these are those tiefs? Their whole city was dragged into Avernus for a while. Zariel was delighted. When they made it back out, I'd hoped they got their happy ending.

125.speaker: Karlach
125.text: Gods, these are those tiefs? Their whole city was dragged into Avernus for a while. Zariel was delighted. When they made it back out, I'd hoped they got their happy ending.

259.speaker: Zevlor
259.text: I'm surprised you haven't heard of it.

134.speaker: Zevlor
134.text: The High Overseer - our grand protector - signed a pact with devils. It dragged Elturel straight to Hell.
134.context: NodeContext: Bitter - talking about a traumatic event that disproportianately affected his people

326.speaker: Zevlor
326.text: Lucky for us, a group of adventurers found a way to bring the city back.

144.speaker: Zevlor
144.text: Afterwards, people looked at us and just saw 'devilkin'. No different from the druids here, really.

165.text: *'The Descent' - an infernal conspiracy that had seen the entire city of Elturel briefly dragged to the Hells.*

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *'The Descent' - an infernal conspiracy that had seen the entire city of Elturel briefly dragged to the Hells.*

99.speaker: Player
99.text: If your people survived that, they'll survive anything.

204.speaker: Zevlor
204.text: So I hoped. But we've lost so many already - and more will die if we're forced out again.

294.speaker: Player
294.text: Is there a place for tieflings anywhere?

185.speaker: Zevlor
185.text: Hah - a fair point. We can only hope the citizens of Baldur's Gate are more open-minded.

358.speaker: Zevlor
358.text: But we can't get there with those beasts blocking our path.

296.speaker: Player
296.text: Maybe your people should have stayed in Hell.
296.context: NodeContext: Suppressing annoyance, pointing out that you're in the same boat

141.speaker: Zevlor
141.text: It seems you're of a mind with our hosts here. But their ritual will force you out, too.
141.context: NodeContext: Suppressing annoyance, pointing out that you're in the same boat

398.speaker: Player
398.text: You made it back from Avernus. Surely you can survive anything?

446.speaker: Player
446.text: Should've stayed in the Hells - our kind might be treated better there.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: That's sad - but it doesn't mean the druids owe you sanctuary.

383.speaker: Zevlor
383.text: Thank you again for your help out there.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Those goblins - have there been many attacks like that?

182.speaker: Player
182.text: Spare me your platitudes about my people. I don't need them.
182.context: NodeContext: Apologetic, embarrassed - reassuring you he's grateful

163.speaker: Zevlor
163.text: I meant no insult. It's simply that yours are a people at war with themselves - I've never known them to care for outsiders.
163.context: NodeContext: Apologetic, embarrassed - reassuring you he's grateful

231.speaker: Zevlor
231.context: NodeContext: You're a stranger to this camp; he's pleased to meet you, maybe a tiny tiny bit wary

426.speaker: Player
426.text: I'm looking for a man named Zorru.
426.context: InternalNodeContext: Blocked if the player killed Zorru before talking to Zevlor because I don't see how Zorru could die otherwise

242.speaker: Zevlor
242.text: You'll find him in camp. What do you want with him?
242.context: NodeContext: untrusting. he doesn't know me or my intentions.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: That is between the two of us.
23.context: NodeContext: Firm and polite request rather than an order.

337.speaker: Zevlor
337.text: You'll find him in the caves. But I warn you not to start trouble. There's already enough going.
337.context: NodeContext: Firm and polite request rather than an order.

76.speaker: Zevlor
76.text: See that you don't distract him from his duties.
76.context: NodeContext: Firm and polite request rather than an order.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: He has seen others of my kind - I wish to know more.
79.context: NodeContext: He hasn't heard the word 'githyanki' before, so he's brushing you off.

8.speaker: Zevlor
8.text: I suppose that's between the two of you.
8.context: NodeContext: He hasn't heard the word 'githyanki' before, so he's brushing you off.

410.speaker: Zevlor
410.text: You'll find him in the caves. But we won't stay here much longer.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: He encountered strange creatures nearby. I wish to know more.

232.speaker: Zevlor
232.text: Right. He's been going on about something of the sort.

105.speaker: Zevlor
105.text: You're the one who knocked my jaw out of joint.
105.context: InternalNodeContext: Plays if the player didn't talk to Zevlor at the gates after KOing him in the confrontationNodeContext: Player knocked Zevlor out to defuse an earlier confrontation - he's a bit aggrieved

331.speaker: Zevlor
331.text: And yet you walk in here like it's your domain. Typical drow arrogance.
331.context: NodeContext: Looking you up and down, irritated

416.speaker: Zevlor
416.text: Lucky for you, you seem to have spooked Aradin and his trash into leaving.
416.context: NodeContext: Brushing off Aradin like a bloodsucking fly

438.speaker: Zevlor
438.text: Raise your hand to one of us again, however, and every tiefling in this encampment will fall on you like a tide.
438.context: NodeContext: Brushing off Aradin like a bloodsucking fly

282.speaker: Player
282.text: Loose tongue, bruised jaw - perhaps they're related?
282.context: NodeContext: Brushing off Aradin like a bloodsucking fly

223.speaker: Zevlor
223.text: I'll survive a sore jaw. And you'll survive as long as you keep your hands to yourself.

374.speaker: Player
374.context: NodeContext: Brushing off Aradin like a bloodsucking fly

360.speaker: Player
360.context: NodeContext: Brushing off Aradin like a bloodsucking fly

368.speaker: Zevlor
368.context: NodeContext: Brushing off Aradin like a bloodsucking fly

6.speaker: Player
6.context: NodeContext: Not interested in the player giving out to him.

177.speaker: Zevlor
177.text: And so will you, if you ever interfere in my business again. That I promise you.
177.context: NodeContext: Not interested in the player giving out to him.

328.speaker: Zevlor
328.text: You helped us fight those goblins. Who are you?
328.context: NodeContext: Coming around, getting his bearings, realizing he should find out more about the player.

315.speaker: Player
315.context: NodeContext: Matter-of-fact. Playuer isn't being particularly friendly, so neither is zevlor

233.speaker: Zevlor
233.text: It will be smart for both of us to make allies of enemies.

59.speaker: Player
59.context: NodeContext: Matter-of-fact. Playuer isn't being particularly friendly, so neither is zevlor

409.speaker: Zevlor
409.text: Right. Best not to stop here.
409.context: NodeContext: Matter-of-fact. Playuer isn't being particularly friendly, so neither is zevlor

68.speaker: Player
68.context: NodeContext: Halting you in your tracks - you struck him, and now he wants you to explain yourself

234.speaker: Zevlor
234.text: Not so fast. After what you did at the gate, I'd like to know who I've let inside these walls.
234.context: NodeContext: Halting you in your tracks - you struck him, and now he wants you to explain yourself

130.speaker: Zevlor
130.text: That was ugly work, but it was them or us.
130.context: InternalNodeContext: Reacts ONCE to druid Attack, then goes back to the nodes between Stage 3 & 4NodeContext: He's reacting to the fact that the druids just attacked his people out of nowhere and were all killed

136.speaker: Zevlor
136.text: Our time grows short. If Kagha won't abandon her madness, then we'll have to try the road - goblins or no.
136.context:
InternalNodeContext: Edit 1/31/2020: This greeting used to be played at the gate, before Zevlor reached the cave. 


When Zevlor KO Aradin himself, the intro is cancelled in the Confrontation dialog directly, that's why this case is not handled in the dialog hereNodeContext: Matter-of-fact but grateful. Player knocked out a schmuck who was about to hit Zevlor.

143.speaker: Zevlor
143.text: You knocked Aradin clean out. And you helped drive the goblins back. Thank you.
143.context:
InternalNodeContext: Edit 1/31/2020: This greeting used to be played at the gate, before Zevlor reached the cave. 


When Zevlor KO Aradin himself, the intro is cancelled in the Confrontation dialog directly, that's why this case is not handled in the dialog hereNodeContext: Matter-of-fact but grateful. Player knocked out a schmuck who was about to hit Zevlor.

142.speaker: Zevlor
142.text: I've always suspected drow weren't nearly so heartless as surface-folk believe. Thank you for providing the proof.

145.speaker: Zevlor
145.text: I heard what happened. Thank you for protecting the child.
145.context: NodeContext: Utter relief, still vaguely in shock - the druids almost killed a child under his care, and he wouldn't have believed it of them. A little shaken at what could have happened

418.speaker: Zevlor
418.text: If the druids are this far gone, then it's not just goblins we have to fear.

111.speaker: Zevlor
111.text: So we can risk violence here or face it for certain on the road. Quite the choice, isn't it?
111.context: NodeContext: Humourless, realising how bad their situation has become

158.speaker: Zevlor
158.text: I'd advise you to settle your affairs here quickly.
158.context: NodeContext: Grim, lot on his mind

386.speaker: Zevlor
386.text: Once the druids complete their ritual, we'll be sharing the road with goblins once again.

51.speaker: Zevlor
51.text: Unless you've reconsidered speaking to them for us? Kagha might listen to you.
51.context: NodeContext: We turned him down before - he's hopeful that we might change our mind

184.speaker: Zevlor
184.text: I didn't want this. It was supposed to be just Kagha... but thank you.
184.context: InternalNodeContext: Reacts ONCE to druid Attack, then goes back to the nodes between Stage 3 & 4NodeContext: Grim, regrets the fact that all the druids were just killed - he asked us to remove only the leader. But he acknowledges we helped him, however it came about

311.speaker: Zevlor
311.text: The druids would have overwhelmed us, if not for you. You've proven yourself a fine warrior - and a better friend.

217.speaker: Zevlor
217.text: You've done so much for us - and I have more yet to ask.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: Let me guess - you want something.

235.speaker: Zevlor
235.text: You've bought us some time here. But the goblins are still massing out there.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Whatever it is, I'm not interested.

22.speaker: Zevlor
22.text: I assure you, it very much concerns you as well as us.

114.speaker: Zevlor
114.text: The goblins are still massing out there.

82.speaker: Zevlor
82.text: By Dhelt's virtue, the Blade of Frontiers? What's happened, Wyll?

200.speaker: Wyll
200.text: I paid the price of angering the wrong devil.

213.speaker: Zevlor
213.text: Believe me - I understand better than most.

167.speaker: Narrator
167.text: *A moment passes as Zevlor contemplates Wyll's words. He then turns his attentions to you.*

226.speaker: Narrator
226.text: *Confusion crosses Zevlor's eyes as he takes you in.*
226.context: NodeContext: Resolute. He won't lead his people to certain death.

237.speaker: Player
237.text: I paid the price of angering the wrong devil.

422.speaker: Player
422.text: I figured I was due a makeover. What do you think?

18.speaker: Zevlor
18.text: Rarely have I seen a pair of more impressive horns. I've seen enough devilish magic to ask whether you came about them voluntarily, though.

244.speaker: Narrator
244.text: *A moment passes as Zevlor contemplates your face. He then turns his attentions elsewhere.*

20.speaker: Zevlor
20.text: My apologies, Wyll. I meant no offence.

246.speaker: Zevlor
246.text: Any word on... what we discussed? About Kagha?
246.context: NodeContext: Resolute. He won't lead his people to certain death.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Removing her isn't the way. Better to face the goblins.
42.context: NodeContext: Resolute. He won't lead his people to certain death.

354.speaker: Zevlor
354.text: These are civilians. Open battle would be a massacre.
354.context: NodeContext: Resolute. He won't lead his people to certain death.

21.speaker: Player
21.context: NodeContext: Relieved, savagely pleased. He's typically unassuming, but Kagha is responsible for the death of a child and he has no pity for her.

26.speaker: Zevlor
26.text: Truly? May Kelemvor judge her justly, then - I've seen Hell, and it's too good for her.
26.context: NodeContext: Relieved, savagely pleased. He's typically unassuming, but Kagha is responsible for the death of a child and he has no pity for her.

179.speaker: Zevlor
179.text: Thank you - we still have the goblins to contend with, but you've given us time to prepare.
179.context: NodeContext: Tone is one of gratitude - needs to work if Zevlor was mad a moment before or serene - so needs to be a gear shift into quiet gratitude

161.speaker: Zevlor
161.text: I need to ensure my people make the most of it. But here - left over from my soldiering days.
161.context: InternalNodeContext: TODO: REWARD SHOULD BE ITEM, AS HE ALREADY GIVES US COIN AND SAY 'IT'S ALL HE HAS'NodeContext: Suddenly industrious, looking forward - but takes a moment to reward us

385.speaker: Zevlor
385.text: It's sparse thanks for what you've done for us but, gods and goblins willing, I won't need it again.

286.speaker: Zevlor
286.text: If you can clear the road of goblins as you say, I'll ensure a reward is gathered for you.

251.speaker: Zevlor
251.text: It's sparse thanks for what you've done for us - and I'm afraid I have more yet to ask.
251.context: NodeContext: Grateful, but bracing himself to ask even more of us

440.speaker: Zevlor
440.text: I'll ensure my people make the most of it. It pains me that I have nothing to give you in thanks.
440.context: NodeContext: Suddenly industrious, looking forward - regretful he hasn't anything to give us

334.speaker: Zevlor
334.text: But I'm gathering what I can from my people. A reward - because I have something else to ask of you.
334.context: NodeContext: Assuring us there's a reward coming, about to ask something greater of us

195.speaker: Zevlor
195.text: Truly? I'm sorry it had to come to this, but she left us with no choice.
195.context: NodeContext: Remorse, but knows it was inevitable

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Kagha's agreed to stop the ritual.
16.context: NodeContext: Genuinely surprised, please - but last sentence tinged with bitterness and sadness - it won't bring the dead back, so he has to look forward

397.speaker: Zevlor
397.text: Truly? Ilmater's ashes, I never thought she would actually see reason. Too late for poor Arabella.
397.context: NodeContext: Genuinely surprised, please - but last sentence tinged with bitterness and sadness - it won't bring the dead back, so he has to look forward

45.speaker: Zevlor
45.text: Truly? Ilmater's ashes, I never thought she would actually see reason.

271.speaker: Player
271.text: Time's up - I've been asked to escort you out of here.

262.speaker: Zevlor
262.context: NodeContext: Firm in this belief, but open to your suggestion

27.speaker: Player
27.text: You can't let the druids force you out.
27.context: NodeContext: Firm in this belief, but open to your suggestion

191.speaker: Zevlor
191.text: So long as Kagha leads them, we'll never be safe here. If you're suggesting we remove her...
191.context: NodeContext: Firm in this belief, but open to your suggestion

187.speaker: Player
187.text: Whatever you decide, I'm not involved in any of this.

395.speaker: Player
395.text: Better to leave on your own terms before it comes to that. I'll help.

240.speaker: Player
240.text: Surely your people can fight off a few goblins.

292.speaker: Zevlor
292.text: Our time grows short. If Kagha won't abandon her madness, then we'll have to try the road - goblins or no.
292.context: NodeContext: Mute shock, grief - he's just heard of the death of a child in his care

299.speaker: Zevlor
299.text: We're ready to head to your camp - are you?
299.context: NodeContext: Mute shock, grief - he's just heard of the death of a child in his care

350.speaker: Zevlor
350.text: I've... already heard. Arabella. Nine summers old, and now she'll never see another.
350.context: NodeContext: Mute shock, grief - he's just heard of the death of a child in his care

5.speaker: Zevlor
5.text: Because of druid 'law'. Every natural law demands I take up my sword, storm their lair, and -
5.context: NodeContext: Building anger. A child is dead because of druid custom, and he wants to cast custom aside and seek revenge. Cuts himself short, controls himself.

36.speaker: Zevlor
36.text: ...But no. That's what Kagha wants. To prove we are exactly what she says - a threat.
36.context: NodeContext: Cut himself off mid-tirade, calming himself down. Still furious, but colder - he won't give his enemy the reaction she wants.

210.speaker: Zevlor
210.text: I won't give her the satisfaction. I'll get my people clear of this - but on our terms.

428.speaker: Player
428.text: Leaving the grove is the best option. I can help.

66.speaker: Zevlor
66.text: You saw what they did to Arabella for trying - a child.

71.speaker: Zevlor
71.text: It's Kagha's influence. Without her twisting things, I believe the druids might see sense.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: Then why don't you get rid of her?
206.context: NodeContext: Considering, grim - he didn't want to kill the druid leader before, but has no such scruples now

332.speaker: Zevlor
332.text: A thought I might have dismissed, before Arabella.
332.context: NodeContext: Considering, grim - he didn't want to kill the druid leader before, but has no such scruples now

146.speaker: Zevlor
146.text: A low thought, but I'd be lying if I said I hadn't considered it.
146.context: NodeContext: Admitting he's thought of assassination already, not proud of it but pragmatic

341.speaker: Zevlor
341.text: But the druids would slaughter us - we'd have to get close to Kagha. Within striking distance.
341.context: NodeContext: Sounding you out, seeing how willing you'd be to commit murder for his people

88.speaker: Zevlor
88.text: I can't manage that... but they've already let you pass once.
88.context: NodeContext: Sounding you out, seeing how willing you'd be to commit murder for his people

423.speaker: Zevlor
423.text: To see Kagha pay? Everything. You'll get your coin.

73.speaker: Zevlor
73.text: Just as soon as I know she's gone.

194.speaker: Zevlor
194.text: To get these people to Baldur's Gate? Everything.

124.speaker: Player
124.context: NodeContext: Grateful, letting you know how important this is to him

325.speaker: Zevlor
325.text: You're taking a risk for us - we'll see that you're rewarded.
325.context: NodeContext: Grateful, letting you know how important this is to him

186.speaker: Zevlor
186.text: I'm still hoping Kagha can be swayed from this madness. But if not...
186.context: NodeContext: Brief moment of introspection - he doesn't want to commit murder - but he'll do anything to save his people

171.speaker: Zevlor
171.text: Leaders need to make tough decisions. We do what we must.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: I'm not some murderer for hire.

362.speaker: Zevlor
362.text: If the issue is coin, I'll ensure you're well rewarded.

117.speaker: Zevlor
117.text: But if you believe Kagha deserves your compassion after what she's done, there's nothing more to discuss.
117.context: NodeContext: Unmoved - he's resolved that Kagha deserves to die because she killed a child, you're not going to change his mind

69.speaker: Zevlor
69.text: It doesn't sit well with me either. But to get these people to safety, there's nothing I won't do.
69.context: NodeContext: Understanding, sympathetic to the reluctance around committing a murder - but resolving himself

275.speaker: Zevlor
275.text: You'd be well rewarded for the risk. But if that won't sway you, there's nothing more to discuss.

339.speaker: Player
339.text: You need to cut your losses and run. I'll help.
339.context: NodeContext: Honestly grateful, but reestablishing the danger. His people would be no safer out on the raod

201.speaker: Zevlor
201.text: It's good of you to offer, but there's a whole army of goblins out there.
201.context: NodeContext: Honestly grateful, but reestablishing the danger. His people would be no safer out on the raod

330.speaker: Zevlor
330.text: We'd need an army of our own to escort us safely to Baldur's Gate, and while I don't doubt your abilities... you're no army.
330.context: NodeContext: Resolved, firm - he's not risking his people. Broaching the request - knows he's asking too much, but has no choice

3.speaker: Zevlor
3.text: There may be a way though. Goblins are ill-disciplined - it's unlike them to organise so cleverly.
3.context: NodeContext: Emphatic - knows he's asking a lot, but believes we can do it

39.speaker: Zevlor
39.text: Somebody must be leading them, bringing discipline to their ranks. Take out that leadership, and they'll scatter.
39.context: NodeContext: Emphatic - knows he's asking a lot, but believes we can do it

221.speaker: Zevlor
221.text: The Blade of Frontiers has done what he can to help us prepare for the journey, and we're grateful, but it'll be a short journey if the goblins still own the roads.
221.context: NodeContext: Emphatic - knows he's asking a lot, but believes we can do it

415.speaker: Wyll
415.text: By the Triad, there is only one correct answer. Refuse him, and we sentence these people to die.

348.speaker: Player
348.text: Kill the goblin horde's leaders? I'll see what I can do.
348.context: NodeContext: Wyll has asked for money. Zevlor doesn't have much to give, but he doesn't have another choice.

276.speaker: Player
276.text: That depends - can you pay me?
276.context: NodeContext: Wyll has asked for money. Zevlor doesn't have much to give, but he doesn't have another choice.

92.speaker: Zevlor
92.text: I suppose so. We don't have much. But we'll scrape together whatever we can.
92.context: NodeContext: Wyll has asked for money. Zevlor doesn't have much to give, but he doesn't have another choice.

333.speaker: Player
333.context: NodeContext: Zevlor will pay it all to get Wyll's help, to help his people.

327.speaker: Zevlor
327.text: Of course. Everything we have. Anything we can give you, we will.
327.context: NodeContext: Zevlor will pay it all to get Wyll's help, to help his people.

318.speaker: Player
318.text: Don't bother. I'll do what I can.

253.speaker: Zevlor
253.text: Everyone in this camp depends on it. Thank you.

95.speaker: Zevlor
95.text: We'll be ready to leave as soon as you give word.

190.speaker: Player
190.text: I have other things to worry about.
190.context: NodeContext: His last hope is to beg Wyll for help and hope it comes.

33.speaker: Zevlor
33.text: Please reconsider. The people in this camp need help. I can only take us so far.
33.context: NodeContext: His last hope is to beg Wyll for help and hope it comes.

402.speaker: Zevlor
402.text: I know you'll do the right thing.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: I don't have time. I need a healer - fast.

147.speaker: Zevlor
147.text: If Nettie can't help you, you'll need to go to Baldur's Gate - and you'll face the same threats as us along the way.

340.speaker: Zevlor
340.text: Kill the goblins, and you'll clear the way for yourself as well.

205.speaker: Player
205.context: NodeContext: 'Torm's truth' is a oath, like 'Jesus Christ'. Distaste for us.

322.speaker: Player
322.text: I'm not interested. You'll go now, as Kagha says, or I'll force you.
322.context: NodeContext: 'Torm's truth' is a oath, like 'Jesus Christ'. Distaste for us.

355.speaker: Zevlor
355.text: Torm's truth. You really are her creature, aren't you?
355.context: NodeContext: 'Torm's truth' is a oath, like 'Jesus Christ'. Distaste for us.

119.speaker: Zevlor
119.text: No. You would send us to our deaths - I'm not going to let it happen.
119.context: NodeContext: Firm - he's ready to fight us if he has to

329.speaker: Zevlor
329.text: It's no small thing to ask, but... I've seen you fight. You're equal to the task.
329.context: NodeContext: Knows he's asking too much, but determined to anyway

197.speaker: Zevlor
197.text: You saw what they were willing to do to a child just for trying.

324.speaker: Player
324.context: NodeContext: Shaking his head - he's already thought of this course of action and dismissed it

344.speaker: Zevlor
344.text: No. The druids are too powerful - we can't stand against them all.
344.context: NodeContext: Shaking his head - he's already thought of this course of action and dismissed it

347.speaker: Player
347.text: Best of luck with that. This has nothing to do with me.
347.context: NodeContext: Disappointed that you won't help

381.speaker: Zevlor
381.text: Do not be so sure - Kagha won't spare you either, if it comes to it.
381.context: NodeContext: Disappointed that you won't help

50.speaker: Zevlor
50.text: I can only hope you see that before it's too late.

436.speaker: Player
436.text: No, you won't - I'm here to make sure you leave.

349.speaker: Player
349.text: I'm not here to advise you. I'm here to make sure you leave.

273.speaker: Zevlor
273.text: So Kagha's twisted your mind as well.
273.context: NodeContext: Disappointment - he thought we were on his side

384.speaker: Zevlor
384.text: So Kagha's twisted your mind as well.
384.context: NodeContext: Disappointment - he thought we were on his side

265.speaker: Zevlor
265.text: Please, just listen - sending us out there is a death sentence. But there is another way.
265.context: NodeContext: Rushing to stop us from acting too rashly and forcing his people out - he has another proposal

115.speaker: Zevlor
115.text: If you want to turn your blade on anyone - turn it on the goblins. You won't be able to cut them all down, there's a horde of them out there.
115.context: NodeContext: Exhorting - trying to make us see reason as if his people's lives depend on it (they do)

390.speaker: Zevlor
390.text: But they're ill-disciplined. It's unusual for them to organise so cleverly.

356.speaker: Zevlor
356.text: Ah. I've already spoken to your travelling companion. Well met.

346.speaker: Player
346.context: NodeContext: Frustrated but polite - he doesn't want to push us, but he desperately needs our help

112.speaker: Zevlor
112.text: Of course - you have your own business to attend to.
112.context: NodeContext: Frustrated but polite - he doesn't want to push us, but he desperately needs our help

129.speaker: Zevlor
129.text: But if the druids won't abandon this ritual of theirs, it will be trouble - for all of us.
129.context: NodeContext: Frustrated but polite - he doesn't want to push us, but he desperately needs our help

430.speaker: Player
430.context: NodeContext: Neutral, waiting for us to explain what we want

431.speaker: Player
431.text: I want to discuss something else.
431.context: NodeContext: Neutral, waiting for us to explain what we want

57.speaker: Zevlor
57.context: NodeContext: Neutral, waiting for us to explain what we want

434.speaker: Zevlor
434.text: There's the First Druid Halsin. This is his grove. Was, I should say.

309.speaker: Zevlor
309.text: He should've returned with the adventurers. Cowards left him behind.
309.context: NodeContext: Disgust in his voice that he was left behind.

439.speaker: Zevlor
439.text: Try his apprentice, Nettie. You'll find her in the druids' circle.
439.context: InternalNodeContext: This node doesn't set LearnedLostHalsin in GLO_Tadpole to make the player focus on Nettie

28.speaker: Zevlor
28.text: Forgive me for presuming, but I think you'll fit right in.

338.speaker: Player
338.text: What brings your people out into the wilds?
338.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

401.speaker: Zevlor
401.text: We're refugees from Elturel - we took shelter here after gnolls and goblins attacked us on the road.
401.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

363.speaker: Zevlor
363.text: We were bound for Baldur's Gate, and it was too late to turn back. Elturel had no place for tieflings after the Descent.
363.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

108.speaker: Narrator
108.text: *You remember it. Elturel and all its citizens were dragged into Avernus - then back out again.*
108.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

373.speaker: Player
373.text: I was there, you know. I'd hoped you'd had a happy ending.

404.speaker: Zevlor
404.text: We got out alive. That's what matters. And you did too, by the looks of things.

9.speaker: Zevlor
9.text: We'll live to tell another tale, if we can just convince these druids not to turn us out on our backsides.

313.speaker: Player
313.text: Let me guess: Your old neighbours called you 'devilkin' and acted like they never knew you.

153.speaker: Zevlor
153.text: How easily such a nasty word slips through the mouth of someone you thought you knew.

266.speaker: Zevlor
266.text: We thought we'd found sanctuary here, but the druids have determined to turn us out.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Gods, these are those tiefs? Their whole city was dragged into Avernus for a while. Zariel was delighted. When they made it back out, I'd hoped they got their happy ending.
61.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

264.speaker: Karlach
264.text: Gods, these are those tiefs? Their whole city was dragged into Avernus for a while. Zariel was delighted. When they made it back out, I'd hoped they got their happy ending.

214.speaker: Zevlor
214.text: *'The Descent' - an infernal conspiracy that had seen the entire city of Elturel briefly dragged to the Hells.*
214.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

372.speaker: Player
372.text: *'The Descent' - an infernal conspiracy that had seen the entire city of Elturel briefly dragged to the Hells.*
372.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

176.speaker: Zevlor
176.text: *'The Descent' - an infernal conspiracy that had seen the entire city of Elturel briefly dragged to the Hells.*
176.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

295.speaker: Narrator
295.text: *'The Descent' - an infernal conspiracy that had seen the entire city of Elturel briefly dragged to the Hells.*

272.speaker: Player
272.text: If your people survived that, they'll survive anything.

307.speaker: Zevlor
307.text: So I hoped. But we've lost so many already - and more will die if we're forced out again.

2.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

314.speaker: Player
314.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

140.speaker: Zevlor
140.text: I'm surprised you haven't heard of it.

405.speaker: Zevlor
405.text: The High Overseer - our grand protector - signed a pact with devils. It dragged Elturel straight to Hell.

220.speaker: Zevlor
220.text: Lucky for us, a group of adventurers found a way to bring the city back.

306.speaker: Zevlor
306.text: Afterwards, people looked at us and just saw 'devilkin'. No different from the druids here, really.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: Is there a place for tieflings anywhere?
175.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

172.speaker: Zevlor
172.text: Hah - a fair point. We can only hope the citizens of Baldur's Gate are more open-minded.

407.speaker: Zevlor
407.text: But we can't get there with those beasts blocking our path.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Maybe your people should have stayed in Hell.
10.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

34.speaker: Player
34.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

252.speaker: Karlach
252.context: NodeContext: Player said something rude. She's offended but still hoping they are kidding, so not too aggro

245.speaker: Player
245.text: Why did Halsin go with the adventurers?

301.speaker: Zevlor
301.text: Some artefact Aradin was hunting. I don't know any more than that - and don't want to.

218.speaker: Zevlor
218.text: This grove is poorer for losing Halsin, but I have my own people's concerns to look to.
218.context: NodeContext: Genuinely sad Halsin is gone, but has to focus on what he can fix

388.speaker: Player
388.text: Halsin's alive - he's being held captive by goblins.
388.context: NodeContext: Genuinely shocked by the news. Happy, but grows somber as he realises what it means

258.speaker: Zevlor
258.text: Gods above. This is wonderful news, but... I've seen what goblins do to their captives.
258.context: NodeContext: Genuinely shocked by the news. Happy, but grows somber as he realises what it means

255.speaker: Zevlor
255.text: I wish we could ride to his rescue, but my people would just wind up slaughtered along with him.
255.context: NodeContext: Full of regret - Halsin is a friend, but they're not in a position to help him

53.speaker: Zevlor
53.text: I'll... I'll pray for him. So long as the goblins hold the roads, I'm afraid it's all we can do.
53.context: NodeContext: Helpless, knows it's not good enough

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I'm looking for a man named Zorru.

419.speaker: Zevlor
419.text: I'm told the druids have stopped their damn chanting. What happened?
419.context: InternalNodeContext: Tells that once to each player, as long as a player doesn't tell him explicitely about Kagha
